name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris.

name: Central Park
description: Urban park in Manhattan, New York City.

name: Tokyo Skytree
description: Broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo.

name: Colosseum
description: Oval amphitheatre in the centre of Rome, Italy.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: A large unfinished Roman Catholic basilica in Barcelona, designed by architect Antoni Gaudí.

name: The Prado Museum
description: Spain's main national art museum, located in central Madrid. It features one of the world's finest collections of European art.

name: Alhambra
description: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Andalusia, Spain. Renowned for its stunning Islamic architecture.

name: Brandenburg Gate
description: An 18th-century neoclassical monument in Berlin, one of the best-known landmarks of Germany.

name: Neuschwanstein Castle
description: A 19th-century Romanesque Revival palace on a rugged hill above the village of Hohenschwangau near Füssen in southwest Bavaria, Germany.

name: Cologne Cathedral
description: A renowned Gothic cathedral in Cologne, Germany. It is a World Heritage Site, famous for its architecture and history.

name: The Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China.

name: The Forbidden City
description: A palace complex in central Beijing, China. It housed the emperors of China for almost 500 years.

name: Park Güell
description: A public park system composed of gardens and architectonic elements located on Carmel Hill, in Barcelona. Designed by Antoni Gaudí.

name: Montjuïc
description: A broad shallow hill with a relatively flat top overlooking the harbor, to the southwest of the city center of Barcelona.

name: Royal Palace of Madrid
description: The official residence of the Spanish Royal Family at the city of Madrid, but it is only used for state ceremonies.

name: Retiro Park
description: A large park in the center of Madrid, known for its beautiful sculptures and monuments, galleries, a peaceful lake, and host to a variety of events.

name: Generalife
description: A villa with gardens located on the Cerro del Sol (Hill of the Sun), adjacent to the Alhambra, which served as a place of recreation and rest for the Muslim kings of Granada.

name: Sierra Nevada
description: A mountain range in the region of Andalucia, containing the highest point of continental Spain, Mulhacén at 3479 meters (11,414 ft).

name: Reichstag Building
description: Historic edifice in Berlin, Germany, constructed to house the Imperial Diet of the German Empire. It was opened in 1894 and housed the Diet until 1933.

name: Berlin Wall Memorial
description: A reminder of the division of Berlin by the Berlin Wall and a tribute to those who lost their lives during its existence.

name: Linderhof Palace
description: A small palace in southwest Bavaria near Ettal Abbey. It is the smallest of the three palaces built by King Ludwig II of Bavaria.

name: Tegelberg
description: A mountain and ski resort in the Ammergau Alps near Hohenschwangau, Bavaria. It offers panoramic views of Neuschwanstein Castle and the surrounding areas.

name: Chocolate Museum
description: A museum in Cologne dedicated to the history of chocolate, from its beginnings with the Olmecs, Maya, and Aztecs to contemporary products and production methods.

name: Cologne Zoo
description: A zoo founded in 1860, featuring over 7,000 animals of more than 700 species on more than 20 hectares.

name: Summer Palace
description: A vast ensemble of lakes, gardens, and palaces in Beijing. It serves as a popular tourist destination and recreational park.

name: Temple of Heaven
description: An imperial complex of religious buildings situated in the southeastern part of central Beijing.

name: Shaanxi History Museum
description: A museum located to the northwest of the Giant Wild Goose Pagoda in Xi'an, Shaanxi Province. It features artifacts from the Zhou to the Tang dynasties.

name: Giant Wild Goose Pagoda
description: A historic Buddhist pagoda in Xi'an, built in 652 during the Tang dynasty as a place to store and translate Sanskrit Buddhist scriptures.
